column2: In today's (1st Jan 2016) 10 a.m news bulletin, this stupid channel live telecasted french kisses and hugs from Times Square which is not acceptable under any circumstances for Us muslims. We have a culture and it is being destroyed by stuff like this. As per rules please.

Respectfully stated, I want to acknowledge you and it is a request that please take some serious actions against some of the bollywood movies PG 18+ contents that promotes porn and other vulgar scenes. Upcoming Movies like "Kya kool hain hum 3" "Grand Masti" "Guddu Ki Gun" etc are contains porn contents. Please Sir you are the authority you can seriously banned such movies all over Pakistan. These movies are continuously shown on cable networks privately and publicly. Channels like 8XM and Jalwa are also showing their publicity songs and trailers. Please Sir I shall be very grateful to you if you take serious action. These contents and movies are creating negative impact on our families and children. As a Patriot of Islamic Public Of Pakistan is truly condemn such things shown on our Entertainment Media.

This complaint is being lodged to inform you regarding the racist comments passed by SAMA TV Channel from now and then on Sindhi people by terming Sindh government as ''Saain Sarkar'' as we know that people except Sindhi & Seraikis rest of the people use Saain slang as a derogatory tool to mimic the Sindhi people. it is in only Sindh where these anchors are flaring such remarks, no such remarks/slangs are passed for rest of the ethnicities. No one dare to call Punjab government as ''Ganja Sarkar'' KpK sarkar as ''Akhrot Sarkar'' Balochistan government as ''Bullock Sarkar'' orMuhajar as ''Bhai/Makar Sarkar'' then why do such slangs are only passed against Sindhis. Please take a stern action against the SAMA Tv management, tv anchors and reporters who are seeding the solid of angst between the two largest ethnicities of Sindh. Moreover, it is also believed that they are promoting this hatred and racism for vested political interests. Serve notices to all of the TV Channels to stop passing racist and derogatory remarks against any of the ethnicity and submit a clear SOP by reminding them of their duty.

On 08-12-2015 ABB TAK TV Channel (Team) alongwith police party raided some cosmetic companies. I was called by a client when he was arrested by them. When I reached Frere Police Station, I was approached by Tahir Niaz who claim as project director ABB TAK TV. He was with others, he was behind raid,he had powers to run or stop program to be shown ON-AIR. Also he can lodge or stop FIR. He advised me to settle for two lac rupees. I refused them bluntly Tahir and his team became violent, asked me out, where their cars were parked. They abused me and threatened for even dire consequences. I have made complaints for their illegal act to police. They are still threatening and harassing me. Please held inquiry to curb all such black mailing cartels that are being run in the name of different TV channels and programs.

Dear PEMRA, I wish to lodge a complaint against HUM network for using unethical means to promote their channel. Let me inform u that this channel uses paid reviewers across social media and fake TRPs to get a positive feedback and influence public opinion. The channel had tried these tactics in the past and had succeeded but it has become more obvious in recent years due to their deteriorating program quality. The viewers can no longer tolerate these malpractices and have a right to report if anything is wrong. Like all channels HUM TV should realize that its struggling with TRPs and should concentrate on improving its program quality. Please issue a final warning to this channel to stop these malpractices or block it across all satellites.

On Jan. 26, 2016 in Shahzeb Khanzada's programme, Geo News showed a report based on press release by Pakistan Rangers, about arrest of 4 employees of Fishermen's Cooperative Society (FCS). The PR linked accused with Lyari Gang-war Uzair Baloch and BLA. One of accused Saeed Baloch is a human rights activist & a leader of FCS employees' union and Pakistan Fisherfolk Forum. In fact Rangers had detained Baloch "illegally" since 15 Jan in custody and civil society was protesting on it. A Constitution petition was also filed in Sindh High Court for his recovery. But TV channel showed one-sided version fed by Rangers. The anchor did not bother to show other side or version of accused’s family. We demand the TV to provide opportunity to the family or leaders of the trade union of FCS to provide the facts in this case.

Pakistani Prime TV during the PSL is displaying the advert of Mecca Gambling house. (video: http://tinyurl.com/jntc9ru ) Muslims across England have protested to the name of this gambling house, named after our holiest city, a protest recognized even by non-Muslims < http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/47352.stm > While Muslims in England are protesting for a name change of the hall, the Islamic State of Pakistan is promoting it on its Prime TV. This is against the very spirit of the Constitution of our State which calls upon the state in the Principles of Policy to ease propagation and teaching of Islam, which we are unable to do yet we are able to blatantly disrespect it. Please have the ad removed ASAP and its funding returned BEFORE the next match of PSL.

On Jan. 26, 2016 in Shahzeb Khanzada's programme, Geo News showed a report based on press release by Pakistan Rangers, about arrest of 4 employees of Fishermen's Cooperative Society (FCS). The PR linked accused with Lyari Gang-war Uzair Baloch and BLA. One of accused Saeed Baloch is a human rights activist & a leader of FCS employees' union and Pakistan Fisherfolk Forum. In fact Rangers had detained Baloch "illegally" since 15 Jan in custody and civil society was protesting on it. A Constitution petition was also filed in Sindh High Court for his recovery. But TV channel showed one-sided version fed by Rangers. The anchor did not bother to show other side or version of accused’s family. We demand the Geo News TV channel to provide opportunity to the family or leaders of the trade union of FCS to give their point of view and present the facts in this case.

Show: Mazaaq Raat Time: 11:00 PM Host of show: Vasay Chaudhry Time stamp of event: 21 min 15 sec Description: Host/ guest made the comment in Urdu "Pathan Hee Pathan Ta, Na Banda Na Banday Kee Zaat" An unconditional apology to viewers by the show is in order. The channel should consider the ramifications of such irresponsible reporting, which will surely not go unnoticed by the public. Many will see the shows promotion of such racist 'humor' as permission to promote racist and stereotyping views. I am sure you can see how any failure by PEMRA to act swiftly on this issue will reflect poorly on the organisation.

Few weeks back a show ‘Mazaaq Raat’ aired on Duniya news aired dehumanizing comments from ex-Pakistani cricketer Aqib Javed.Due to mass uproar on social media and huge number of complaints to PEMRA. In a skit meant to be apology for the said comments, a clown was presented who was claimed to be representing all Pushtuns.The said clown was angry at the comments of Aqib Javed and threatened to leave his menial job, to which the host of the show apologized and the clown-representing-all-Pushtuns accepted that apology.This is the ever nasty portrayal of Pashtuns,have you ever seen a Pashun mimicking a Punjabi by farting in the public?we will do a public compaign for your racism. 1. PEMRA should notify Duniya news to apologize unconditionally and in written form to Puhstun nation for its constant mockery and clowning of Puhstuns. 2. The program ‘Mazaaq Raat’ should be taken off-air immediately. 3. A special body be set-up to receive all such complaints about stereotyping, caricaturing and clowning of any nation or group of people. This clowning violates several of clauses of PEMRA acts and can result in law suits against the actors and directors of any show. We expect PEMRA to take stock of our concerns and fulfill its legal responsibilities by meeting our demands."

Dear Sir, I would like to draw your attention toward the latest advertisement of Q Mobile i2, which is being aired on all major TV channels. In this advertisement, the lead actor says Q mobile i2 "jo le le sab ki.........photo". This is an indirect way of degrading other mobile phone manufacturers in a very cheap way. This line "le le sab ki" is used in our society in a very derogatory manner suggesting an unnatural act. In law, such a statement is an innuendo as it suggests/implies some hidden or subtle meaning. This is in violation of PEMRA Ordinance and rules as it is against the social norms and standards of the society. PEMRA should ask all TV channels to either stop the Qmobile i2 commercial or ask Qmobile to to change/censor this commercial.

This complaint relates to poor standard of broadcast of Euro Cup 2016’s (“EUC16”) opening match on Geo Super, the only channel which is telecasting this mega event in Pakistan. The following basic features of football match broadcast were missing during the said live telecast: 1. No scorecard was reflected on the screens during the entire match. 2. No match commentary was telecasted during the match. It is for the foregoing facts that PEMRA’s attention is drawn to take an immediate action against Geo Super, rectify the shortcomings and insure that high standards are met while telecasting the remaining matches of EUC16. observations and concerns regarding the Ramadan Transmissions by almost all the TV channels. The following is currently being transmitted: 1. A reporter of Express News at Edhi Village was reporting while lying down in Abdul Sattar Edhi's grave with mic in his hand. Reporters like these have no respect for great men and are prepared to fall to any low level just for the sake of viewership. This was being viewed at their channel on 9th July 2016 at around 02:45 a.m. or 03:45 a.m. This is a serious lack of professional attitude in journalism. Please require channels to educate their reporters about limits of free press. I have seen such reporters who, in times of emergency or bomb blast or any unpleasant event, rush to hospitals and fall over injured patients while questioning them about silly questions such as "how do you feel" when they are in agony and point mics at their faces. They interrupt doctors from doing their job. They go to families of those who don't survive and take interviews from their 5 year old children or minors and make video of them crying for their lost parent. These channels then, to make viewers emotional, play this footage with emotional background music. They sell our emotions to attract more viewers.

I am a lawyer at a firm dealing with media laws. The complaint is regarding Express News' transmission dated 09.07.2016, showing a news reporter of Express News reporting whilst lying inside the grave of Late Mr. Abdul Sattar Edhi with the headline stating 'Abdul Sattar Edhi's Aakhri Aaraam Gah'. The Reporter's act and the Express News' audacity of allowing such an act is highly inappropriate and illegal under s.20 of the PEMRA Ordinance 2002. This shows the lows our media channels can stoop to for mere views and ratings. This was an insensitive, distasteful and a disgusting tactic used by Express News which is against our religion, our beliefs and our morals. Please take necessary action against the Licensee of Express News.

The coverage of Edhi's funeral included one reporter reporting while lying in his empty grave. It was extremely ridiculous and disrespectful. Picture is available at the link: http://imgur.com/a/bgq4g There is a need of a guideline for respectful coverage, and a need for imposing fines and/or bans on channels and reporters who violate it. There was a reporter on Dawn News today who was speaking to one of the residents of Edhi's homes who was mentally disabled, and the reporter's question made him burst into tears on camera. Even earlier, on Eid, several TV channels were reporting from Amjad Sabri's home, and exploiting his family's grief. This kind of coverage is not dignified, and freedom of expression aside, channels need to be admonished when they indulge in this kind of reporting.

A guideline be given to channels to respect the sentiments of different cultural groups and communities.
